Description.0: About a quarter of the piece is preserved.
Description.1: About half of the piece is preserved.

Further information.1: 101 Ancient Cultures, 410-01 Building and Construction History

Subjects.0: 101 Ancient Cultures, 410-01 Building and Construction History
Subjects.2: 101 Ancient Cultures, 410-01 Building and Construction History

abstract.0: Ionic capital, found along the North side of the temple; about a quarter of the piece is preserved including parts of the echinus as well as the palmette between volute and echinus. Surface coatings, perhaps part of color rendering, were found on the Lesbian cyma of the abacus and on the mouldings of the echinus (scientific analysis pending).
abstract.1: Ionic capital, found along one of the temple’s long sides; about half of the piece is preserved. The balteus is decorated with a lotus flower and the bolster with alternating long and short leaves of reed. Traces of coating, perhaps colour, were found on the bolster and on the Lesbian cyma of the abacus (scientific analysis pending).
abstract.2: Block with base moulding of the cella wall; ovolo and cavetto mouldings are carved with leaves, which carry traces of a coating in hues of ochre, perhaps remains of coloring (scientific analysis pending).

dating.0: end of 3rd / beginning of 2nd century B.C.
dating.1: end of 3rd / beginning of 2nd century B.C.

description.0: Following up on professional photography, 3D models were produced with two types of Laser Scanners, a Structured-Light Scanner and Structure-from-Motion (SfM). Deviations between the different 3D models are visualized in surface comparisons.
description.1: Following up on professional photography, 3D models were produced with two types of Laser Scanners, a Structured-Light Scanner and Structure-from-Motion (SfM). Deviations between the different 3D models are visualized in surface comparisons.
